intro: Phyllanthus chrysanthus var. chrysanthus, commonly known as the golden phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its upright, woody stems and dense clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, oval-shaped fruits that contain a single seed, and its leaves are typically alternate, simple, and elliptical in shape. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open woodlands.
